goal.ch: 大英帝國是人類歷史上最大的帝國，在上世紀二十年代，曾經管治全球四分之一土地。大英帝國的影響更是源遠流長，重新界定了「現代」世界。在過去二百年，其生產、輸出的殖民現代性，可以說深入世界每個角落，包括從沒受其直接管治的，如日本、台灣等地。本課程專門為對英語文學、殖民主義、帝國主義、歐美現代性及後殖民文化構成有興趣的同學而設，加強思考殖民如何重構性/別、階級及種族階序、文學敘事再現與文化政治的關係、殖民文化等。課上也會鋪墊帝國主義如何過渡至冷戰歷史延續性的理論基礎，對拆解亞洲分段困局，及了解我們今天身處的世界及其多重「現代性」，將有助益。
goal.en:
The British Empire at its peak in 1922 was the largest empire the world had ever seen, covering around a quarter of Earth‘s land surface and ruling over 458 million people. It has defined for us, in many ways, for almost two centuries, what would be considered “modern.“ Understanding British colonial modernity is crucial for us to arrive at a contextualized (re)assessment of “modernity“ and its variations today. 

This seminar course is designed for students interested in studying English culture in fresh, contemporary and challenging lights, and/or in conducting research on colonial and post-colonial literary and cultural representations and formations. Focusing on the complex relations between English colonial and post-colonial narratives, it seeks to forge a better understanding of how colonial discourses have (re)configured racial/ethnic, gender and class relations in the modern and contemporary world.

outline.ch: 我們將以文化研究角度的當代目光重新審視從18世紀以降英國文學中對於帝國及殖民的思考，及殖民論述如何重塑族群、性/別與階級關係，亦會考量十九世紀末至二十世紀文學及電影中呈現的情感政治、慾望、焦慮與現代倫理價值。
outline.en:
We will re-situate key English literary texts amidst historical and imaginary formations of colonial modernity.
You are advised to have read A Small Place (Jamaica Kincaid) before attending the first session.

flexDiscription.ch: 以小組討論、研究提案、書寫論文、讀書/觀影報告作為學習方法。同學運用最後兩週總結學習心得，及完成研究報告與論文。
flexDiscription.en: This seminar is designed as a student-tailored, project-based learning process. Students use the last two weeks to finish their final research project and learn from group discussions.
